Documentation.long_help: This filter will take a vtkTable object and reshape it. This filter essentially treats vtkTables as 2D matrices and reshapes them using numpy.reshape in a C contiguous manner. Unfortunately, data fields will be renamed arbitrarily because VTK data arrays require a name.
Documentation.short_help: This filter will take a vtkTable object and reshape it. This filter essentially treats vtkTables as 2D matrices and reshapes them using numpy.reshape in a C contiguous manner. Unfortunately, data fields will be renamed arbitrarily because VTK data arrays require a name.

StringVectorProperty.name: BUILDVERSION
StringVectorProperty.label: BUILDVERSION
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This is an attribute to the filter to know what version it was built on. This is necessary for plugins that have major changes across versions and might need to alert a user that their state file is out of date.

IntVectorProperty.name: OutputDataSetType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property determines the dataset type for the output of the programmable filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: Order
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This is the type of memory ordering to use.

StringVectorProperty.name: Array_Names
StringVectorProperty.label: Array Names
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: A semicolon (;) seperated list of names for the arrays

StringVectorProperty.name: Script
StringVectorProperty.default_values:
from PVGPpy.filters_general import reshapeTable
pdi = self.GetInput() #vtkTable pdo = self.GetOutput() #vtkTable
mem = 'C' if Order == 0: mem = 'F'
reshapeTable(pdi, nrows, ncols, names=Array_Names, order=mem, pdo=pdo)
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the text of a python program that the programmable source runs.

StringVectorProperty.name: PythonPath
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: A semi-colon (;) separated list of directories to add to the python library search path.

Documentation.long_help: Takes points from a vtkPolyData object and constructs a line of those points then builds a polygonal tube around that line with some specified radius and number of sides.
Documentation.short_help: Takes points from a vtkPolyData object and constructs a line of those points then builds a polygonal tube around that line with some specified radius and number of sides.

StringVectorProperty.name: BUILDVERSION
StringVectorProperty.label: BUILDVERSION
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This is an attribute to the filter to know what version it was built on. This is necessary for plugins that have major changes across versions and might need to alert a user that their state file is out of date.

IntVectorProperty.name: OutputDataSetType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property determines the dataset type for the output of the programmable filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: Script
StringVectorProperty.default_values:
from PVGPpy.filters_general import pointsToTube pdi = self.GetInput() # VTK PolyData Type pdo = self.GetOutput() # VTK PolyData Type
pointsToTube(pdi, radius=Radius, numSides=Number_of_Sides, nrNbr=Use_nearest_nbr, pdo=pdo)
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the text of a python program that the programmable source runs.

Documentation.long_help: This is a simple example of a Python Programmable Filter
Documentation.short_help: This is a simple example of a Python Programmable Filter

StringVectorProperty.name: BUILDVERSION
StringVectorProperty.label: BUILDVERSION
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This is an attribute to the filter to know what version it was built on. This is necessary for plugins that have major changes across versions and might need to alert a user that their state file is out of date.

IntVectorProperty.name: OutputDataSetType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property determines the dataset type for the output of the programmable filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: test_bool
IntVectorProperty.label: test bool
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This is a description about the test_bool property!

StringVectorProperty.name: Script
StringVectorProperty.default_values:
from vtk.util import numpy_support as nps import PVGPpy._helpers as inputhelp pdi = self.GetInput() # VTK Data Type pdo = self.GetOutput() # VTK Data Type # Get input array info (selection made in drop down menu) name = inputhelp.getSelectedArrayName(self, 0) field = inputhelp.getSelectedArrayField(self, 0)
if test_bool: print(name,field) else: print(test_string)
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the text of a python program that the programmable source runs.

StringVectorProperty.name: InformationScript
StringVectorProperty.label: RequestInformation Script
StringVectorProperty.default_values: from paraview import util # This script is usually not necessary for filters # Here's an example of setting extents that might be necessary for plugin to function correctly: #util.SetOutputWholeExtent(self, [0,nx-1, 0,ny-1, 0,nz-1]) print('Have a great day!')
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property is a python script that is executed during the RequestInformation pipeline pass. Use this to provide information such as WHOLE_EXTENT to the pipeline downstream.

StringVectorProperty.name: PythonPath
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: A semi-colon (;) separated list of directories to add to the python library search path.

Documentation.long_help: This filter will add linear cell connectivity between scattered points. You have the option to add VTK_Line or VTK_PolyLine connectivity. VTK_Line connectivity makes a straight line between the points in order (either in the order by index or using a nearest neighbor calculation). The VTK_PolyLine adds a poly line connectivity between all points as one spline (either in the order by index or using a nearest neighbor calculation).
Documentation.short_help: This filter will add linear cell connectivity between scattered points. You have the option to add VTK_Line or VTK_PolyLine connectivity. VTK_Line connectivity makes a straight line between the points in order (either in the order by index or using a nearest neighbor calculation). The VTK_PolyLine adds a poly line connectivity between all points as one spline (either in the order by index or using a nearest neighbor calculation).

StringVectorProperty.name: BUILDVERSION
StringVectorProperty.label: BUILDVERSION
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This is an attribute to the filter to know what version it was built on. This is necessary for plugins that have major changes across versions and might need to alert a user that their state file is out of date.

IntVectorProperty.name: OutputDataSetType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property determines the dataset type for the output of the programmable filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: Cell_Type
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Choose what type of cell connectivity to have.

IntVectorProperty.name: Use_nearest_nbr
IntVectorProperty.label: Use nearest nbr
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Check this to use SciPy's cKDTree nearest neighbor algorithms to sort the points to before adding linear connectivity

StringVectorProperty.name: Script
StringVectorProperty.default_values: from PVGPpy.filters_general import connectCells # Get input/output of Proxy pdi = self.GetInput() # VTK PolyData Type pdo = self.GetOutput() # VTK PolyData Type # Perfrom task connectCells(pdi, cellType=Cell_Type, nrNbr=Use_nearest_nbr, pdo=pdo, logTime=False)

Documentation.long_help: Use `np.correlate()` on `mode='same'` on two selected arrays from one input.
Documentation.short_help: Use `np.correlate()` on `mode='same'` on two selected arrays from one input.

StringVectorProperty.name: BUILDVERSION
StringVectorProperty.label: BUILDVERSION
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This is an attribute to the filter to know what version it was built on. This is necessary for plugins that have major changes across versions and might need to alert a user that their state file is out of date.

IntVectorProperty.name: OutputDataSetType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property determines the dataset type for the output of the programmable filter.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Multiplier
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Multiplier
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This is a static shifter/scale factor across the array after normalization.

StringVectorProperty.name: New_Array_Name
StringVectorProperty.label: New Array Name
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Give the new normalized array a meaningful name.

StringVectorProperty.name: Script
StringVectorProperty.default_values: from PVGPpy.filters_general import correlateArrays import PVGPpy._helpers as inputhelp # Get input/output of Proxy pdi = self.GetInput() pdo = self.GetOutput() # Grab input arrays to process from drop down menus # Simply grab the name and field association name0 = inputhelp.getSelectedArrayName(self, 0) field0 = inputhelp.getSelectedArrayField(self, 0) name1 = inputhelp.getSelectedArrayName(self, 1) field1 = inputhelp.getSelectedArrayField(self, 1) # Pass array names and associations on to process correlateArrays(pdi, (name0,field0), (name1,field1), multiplier=Multiplier, newName=New_Array_Name, pdo=pdo)
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the text of a python program that the programmable source runs.

StringVectorProperty.name: PythonPath
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: A semi-colon (;) separated list of directories to add to the python library search path.

Documentation.long_help: A filter to convert a table with Latitude, Longitude, and Altitude information to XYZ points. ISSUE: Assumes spherical Earth.
Documentation.short_help: A filter to convert a table with Latitude, Longitude, and Altitude information to XYZ points. ISSUE: Assumes spherical Earth.

StringVectorProperty.name: BUILDVERSION
StringVectorProperty.label: BUILDVERSION
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This is an attribute to the filter to know what version it was built on. This is necessary for plugins that have major changes across versions and might need to alert a user that their state file is out of date.

IntVectorProperty.name: OutputDataSetType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property determines the dataset type for the output of the programmable filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: Script
StringVectorProperty.default_values: from PVGPpy.filters_general import latLonTableToCartesian import PVGPpy._helpers as inputhelp # Get input/output of Proxy pdi = self.GetInput() pdo = self.GetOutput() # Grab input arrays to process from drop down menus # Simply grab the name and field association namelat = inputhelp.getSelectedArrayName(self, 0) fieldlat = inputhelp.getSelectedArrayField(self, 0) namelon = inputhelp.getSelectedArrayName(self, 1) fieldlon = inputhelp.getSelectedArrayField(self, 1) namealt = inputhelp.getSelectedArrayName(self, 2) fieldalt = inputhelp.getSelectedArrayField(self, 2) # Pass on to do conversion latLonTableToCartesian(pdi, (namelat, fieldlat), (namelon, fieldlon), (namealt, fieldalt), radius=Radius, pdo=pdo)
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the text of a python program that the programmable source runs.

StringVectorProperty.name: PythonPath
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: A semi-colon (;) separated list of directories to add to the python library search path.

Documentation.long_help: This filter allows the user to select an array from the input data set to be normalized. The filter will append another array to that data set for the output. The user can specify how they want to rename the array, can choose a multiplier, and can choose from several types of common normalizations (more functionality added as requested).
Documentation.short_help: This filter allows the user to select an array from the input data set to be normalized. The filter will append another array to that data set for the output. The user can specify how they want to rename the array, can choose a multiplier, and can choose from several types of common normalizations (more functionality added as requested).

StringVectorProperty.name: BUILDVERSION
StringVectorProperty.label: BUILDVERSION
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This is an attribute to the filter to know what version it was built on. This is necessary for plugins that have major changes across versions and might need to alert a user that their state file is out of date.

IntVectorProperty.name: OutputDataSetType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property determines the dataset type for the output of the programmable filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: Normalization
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This is the type of normalization to apply to the input array.

IntVectorProperty.name: Absolute_Value
IntVectorProperty.label: Absolute Value
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This will take the absolute value of the array before normalization.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Multiplier
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Multiplier
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This is a static shifter/scale factor across the array after normalization.

StringVectorProperty.name: New_Array_Name
StringVectorProperty.label: New Array Name
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Give the new normalized array a meaningful name.

StringVectorProperty.name: Script
StringVectorProperty.default_values: from PVGPpy.filters_general import normalizeArray import PVGPpy._helpers as inputhelp # Choose range to use: if Use_Range: rng = Range else: rng = None # Get input/output of Proxy pdi = self.GetInput() pdo = self.GetOutput() # Grab input arrays to process from drop down menus # Simply grab the name and field association name = inputhelp.getSelectedArrayName(self, 0) field = inputhelp.getSelectedArrayField(self, 0) # Perfrom normalization normalizeArray(pdi, (name,field), Normalization, multiplier=Multiplier, newName=New_Array_Name, pdo=pdo, abs=Absolute_Value, rng=rng)
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the text of a python program that the programmable source runs.

StringVectorProperty.name: PythonPath
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: A semi-colon (;) separated list of directories to add to the python library search path.

Documentation.long_help: This is a simple example of a Python Programmable Filter with mutiple inputs.
Documentation.short_help: This is a simple example of a Python Programmable Filter with mutiple inputs.

StringVectorProperty.name: BUILDVERSION
StringVectorProperty.label: BUILDVERSION
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This is an attribute to the filter to know what version it was built on. This is necessary for plugins that have major changes across versions and might need to alert a user that their state file is out of date.

IntVectorProperty.name: OutputDataSetType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property determines the dataset type for the output of the programmable filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: Script
StringVectorProperty.default_values:
from vtk.util import numpy_support as nps import PVGPpy._helpers as inputhelp pdo = self.GetOutput() # VTK Data Type # Inputs from different ports: pdi0 = self.GetInputDataObject(0, 0) # PORT 0 pdi1 = self.GetInputDataObject(1, 0) # PORT 1
# DO STUFF WITH INOUTS AND OUTPUTS print(type(pdi0)) print(type(pdi1))
name0 = inputhelp.getSelectedArrayName(self, 0) name1 = inputhelp.getSelectedArrayName(self, 1)
print(name0,name1)
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the text of a python program that the programmable source runs.

StringVectorProperty.name: PythonPath
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: A semi-colon (;) separated list of directories to add to the python library search path.
